data.text:
Avril Lavigne's Self-Titled Fifth Studio Album on 2LP. Featuring Three Bonus Tracks.

Avril Lavigne is the 5th studio album from Avril Lavigne, originally released on November 1, 2013. It features the digital expanded edition track-list on vinyl for the first time, adding 3 bonus tracks and the hits “Hello Kitty”, “Here’s to Never Growing Up” and “Rock N Roll.” Pressed on black vinyl.

Avril Lavigne, born on September 27, 1984, is a Canadian singer, songwriter, and actress who gained fame in the early 2000s with her pop-punk music and rebellious image. Born and raised in Ontario, Canada, Lavigne showed an interest in music at a young age and began singing in church choirs and local talent shows.

Her breakthrough came in 2002 with her debut album "Let Go," which featured hit singles like "Complicated" and "Sk8er Boi." The album's success propelled Lavigne to international fame, earning her multiple Grammy nominations and establishing her as a prominent figure in the pop-punk genre.

Throughout her career, Lavigne has released several successful albums, including "Under My Skin" (2004), "The Best Damn Thing" (2007), and "Goodbye Lullaby" (2011). Her music often explores themes of youth, individuality, and empowerment, resonating with a diverse audience.
